text: Angama Mara is a safari lodge in the Maasai Mara in Kenya. It is located on the site where several scenes of Sydney Pollack's Out of Africa (1985) were filmed. It has supporting offices in Nairobi & Johannesburg. The lodge was developed by Steve and Nicky Fitzgerald and opened in June 2015. In 2018, it was listed in Condé Nast Traveler as the #1 resort in Africa. In the Kiswahili language, "angama" means "suspended in mid-air"; the name refers to the lodge's location above the floor of the Maasai Mara. == References == == External links == * Category:Resorts in Africa Category:2015 establishments in Kenya
